messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE:unsubscribe! and Joyce/Acceptable for Group?
messages.msgSnippet: ... I take full responisbility  for being a foul-mouthed ungodly English foreigner. ... I m just intrigued as too why. Part of our unschooling adventure has
messages.messageBody:
SandraDodd@... wrote:

> For unsubscribing, that's self-service by e-mailing the address given at the
> bottom of this and every single e-mail.
>
> The list of things Americans don't say did get too rough. Sorry.
> I'd like to blame Shyrley because she's English and she asked the question,
> but
> I didn't tone down my response. Sorry.

I take full responisbility for being a foul-mouthed ungodly English foreigner.

>
>
> But this is proof that even among adults, even when answering another
> person's question about what is and isn't acceptable, there are Americans who
> can't abide those words AT ALL, not even a little. One of the worst crimes
> in the United States is bad language, it seems.

I'm just intrigued as too why. Part of our unschooling adventure has been learning why the Americans and British are so wildly different. My kids spent ages reading up on the American flag cos it seems
so important here. Our flag ain't.

>
>
> That means the South Park Movie is profoundly right in their message.

Yup.
I'll put little stars in all my words now.

Shyrley

messages.subject: RE:unsubscribe! and Joyce/Acceptable for Group?
messages.msgSnippet: For unsubscribing, that s self-service by e-mailing the address given at the bottom of this and every single e-mail. The list of things Americans don t say did
messages.messageBody:
For unsubscribing, that's self-service by e-mailing the address given at the
bottom of this and every single e-mail.

The list of things Americans don't say did get too rough. Sorry.
I'd like to blame Shyrley because she's English and she asked the question,
but
I didn't tone down my response. Sorry.

But this is proof that even among adults, even when answering another
person's question about what is and isn't acceptable, there are Americans who
can't abide those words AT ALL, not even a little. One of the worst crimes
in the United States is bad language, it seems.

That means the South Park Movie is profoundly right in their message.

<<Joyce, is this acceptable?
I cannot believe this is on unschooling. com.
I need to verification that this is acceptable here.>>

and

<< Please unsubscribe me

Blessings,
Deb Hartrum
Managing Editor
Disciples Now Ministries
deb@... >>
